content.description:
Start on the right side and traverse right into the small dihedral slot. Continue up, and meet Hermit's Escape near the top.  

  5.12? variation: Direct Start. Climb straight up into the small dihedral. Some cleaning will probable be required for this route to go.
content.protection: Top rope. Scramble up the backside ridge of the spire. Two large cordoletts around the top should do, but make sure they can't slide up and that they're long enough! I placed some nuts to keep the slings from slipping over the top just in case.
content.location: Start on the left and traverse right.

content.description:
Start on the left side and climb up the arete. until you can transition onto the face, there are many different variations.  

  5.9 variation: Stem the block on the left before exiting onto the face.
content.protection: Top rope. Scramble up the backside ridge of the spire. Two large 20+ft slings around the top should do, but make sure they can't slide up! I placed some nuts to keep the slings from slipping over the top.
content.location: Left side of the Spire's arete which faces the trail.

content.description:
A prominent 35ft spire right off the GSL trail with good moderate lines. There is potential for more difficult routes on the overhanging back side.    This spire is right off the GSL trail so on busy days you will have hikers stop and watch.  

  The rock is generally pretty good, although this climb needs further cleaning from future ascents.
